Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. CM Devendra Fadnavis invited to address.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena, for the first time invited a politician other than a party member as a guest. Chief minister Devendra Fadnavis would be the first person, who will attend the programme and address shivsainik on the occasion of party's 53rd foundation days, on Wednesday evening at Matunga's Shanmugham hall.  A Sena leader confirmed that CM Fadnavis has been invited by the party or foundation day programme and has been accepted an invitation by him. Late Sena Supremo Balasaheb Thackeray had a good rapport with many political party top brass beyond politics. Sena wants to spread a message that 'all is well' in the saffron alliance.  such as socialist George Fernandes, former home minister in the state and late congress leader Balasaheb Desai, NCP chief Sharad Pawar, Communist leader Shripad Amrut Dange, former CM and congress leader Vasantdada Patil and few others were witnessed at some or other event organised by Sena. Sr Thackeray also met former prime minister Indira Gandhi, Chandrashekhar, I K Gujral, former Tamil Nadu CM MK Karunanidhi and other national leaders to discuss the issues, however no one was invited for the foundation day, other than a party member. Sena wants to spread a message that 'all is well' in the saffron alliance. "Misleading news about bitterness among both got spread over since last few days. But we are in an alliance and misleading news could lead to spread wrong message across all, 288 assembly constituencies ahead of assembly polls. To should avoid such misunderstanding ahead of elections was an important task, hence the party invited Fadnavis to address shivsainiks," said a Sena functionary. While asked why only Fadnavis, "He is a good orator with clean image, understanding, clear thoughts and a leading leader of the BJP in the state. Not only BJP cadre but even Shivsainiks are fond of him. Sharing dais with Uddhavji could be normal thing but participating as a special guest for only Sena function will definitely clear the air between both cadre and that will help both while facing assembly polls soon," he added. Western Express Highway crash: Teen drun.description: MUMBAI: A drunk teenager crashed his speeding SUV into an aggregator cab on Western Express Highway in Goregaon (East), killing one of the passengers and injuring the cab driver early on Monday. The Aarey police arrested Kandivli resident Sudhanshu Saboo and took him to the nearest hospital for a medical check-up where preliminary test revealed that he was driving under the influence of alcohol. “The accused does not have a driving licence and was driving drunk,” said Aarey police senior inspector Vijaylaxmi Hiremath. Additional commissioner of police (north region) Dilip Sawant said: “We are also collecting details of the firm that allowed Saboo to drive without checking if he had a valid licence. Action will be taken against the authorities in whose name the car is registered.” The police said around 1.45am, Saboo was driving the SUV at over 120kmph and rammed into the aggregator cab, which spun three times before it came to a halt. The injured driver, Suraj Ramani (21), managed to stagger out of the vab, but the passenger, Shailesh Mishra (33), who was in the back seat, suffered a deep cut between his nose and chin and was profusely bleeding. “Only four people came forward to help us and nab Saboo; others were busy clicking pictures and making videos of the incident on their phones. Someone even stole my phone and Rs 1,250 cash from my pocket,” said Ramani, who had bought his car on loan just three months ago. “There were two more people in the SUV, besides the teenage driver. They both fled the spot.” Ramani and Mishra were taken to a civic-run hospital, but the latter died before treatment. “I had to get a chest X-ray of my chest. I also suffered injuries on my leg,” said Ramani. Saboo has been booked for driving drunk and culpable homicide not amounting to murder under the relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code and Motor Vehicle Act. On Tuesday, he was produced before a local court, which sent him to judicial custody. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP Candidate List.description: NEW DELHI: Amid rumblings over ticket denials in some seats like Kanpur, where saffron veteran   Murli Manohar Joshi has been benched   , and Bangalore South, where the wife of late party leader Ananth Kumar was overlooked for a young debutant, BJP issued on Tuesday a list of 43 nominees for the Lok Sabha polls. Not budging in the face of Joshi’s stiff resistance to being asked to step aside, BJP announced Satyadev Pachauri, a minister in the UP cabinet, as the replacement for the octogenarian leader. The list of 30 candidates for UP, however, accommodated women and child welfare minister Maneka Gandhi and her son Varun Gandhi, who were allowed to swap their Pilibhit and Sultanpur seats. Other interesting picks include   actor-politician Jaya Prada   , who was named against SP leader Azam Khan from Rampur in UP soon after she joined BJP. The selection ignites an old and bitter rivalry, as the former Bollywood star is close to former SP leader Amar Singh who has scores to settle with SP and Khan. Another UP cabinet minister, Rita Bahuguna Joshi, a former UP Congress chief who joined BJP, will contest from the prestigious constituency of Allahabad, where the sitting party MP, Shyama Charab Gupta, has left for SP and is contesting from Banda. She is the daughter of the late H N Bahuguna, a former UP chief minister and well-known Congress leader. Law minister Ravi Shankar Prasad, the party’s candidate from Patna Sahib, faced protests when he landed in Patna on Tuesday. The protesters claimed loyalty to BJP’s Rajya Sabha MP R K Sinha, who was later pulled up by the party while sources said the heckling was led by a person identified as an expelled BJP member. Varun Gandhi, who has had his ups and downs in BJP, was on the list of nominees and will stake his claim for Pilibhit, which has been a family bastion. Maneka Gandhi will be pitted in a triangular contest against SP-BSP alliance candidate Chandrabhanu Singh, alias Sonu Singh, a local politician with clout among Rajput voters who could have turned up the heat for Varun. Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh is in the fray as the Congress nominee. Joshi, a former BJP president, made no secret of his displeasure at being denied a ticket and went public by releasing a letter addressed to voters of Kanpur saying he received a call from party general secretary (organisation) Ramlal asking him not to contest the polls. Joshi, 85, has been asked not to contest just as it was decided that 91-year-old party patriarch L K Advani will not fight from Gandhinagar. Joshi’s defiant note was possibly the reason behind the nomination of a Brahmin face as another UP state minister, Satish Mahana, had been talked of as the frontrunner to replace the veteran leader The party decision is in line with several veterans not being nominated to pave way for younger leaders. The 2019 election will see the curtain drop on the electoral politics of what was seen the Vajpayee-Advani era in the party. BJP has also not given tickets to B C Khanduri, Karia Munda, Kalraj Mishra, Bijoya Chakravarty — all MPs for several terms and over 80 years of age. BJP sprang a surprise by giving 28-year-old Tejaswi Surya, an advocate and Karnataka Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha general secretary, the ticket from Bangalore South, belying expectations that Tejaswini Ananth Kumar would be its choice for the constituency her husband represented six times. The choice triggered strong protests and even state BJP president B S Yeddyurappa said they had sent only Tejaswini’s name, which, he claimed, was changed in Delhi. Tejaswini had to issue statements to mollify her supporters as she said the polls were about re-electing Narendra Modi as Prime Minister. BJP has announced 349 candidates, including 62 in UP, so far. Two seats in UP have been left for alliance partner Apna Dal (Sonelal). Party president Amit Shah will decide the remaining 16 seats in UP where sitting MPs are likely to be replaced, and a reason behind delaying the announcement is to reduce prospects of dissidence and rebellion. The party has so far dropped 14 sitting MPs in UP. BJP general secretary Arun Singh announced that Union minister Manoj Sinha has been fielded from Ghazipur, a seat he had won in 2014. BJP’s Kisan Morcha chief Birendra Singh Mast has been shifted from his sitting seat Bhadohi to far-east Ballia in UP, replacing sitting MP Bharat Singh, whose poor performance was a concern for the party. Agra MP Ram Shankar Katheria, head of the SC commission who had been denied renomination from the current seat, has been moved to Etawah (SC), replacing Ashok Kumar Dohray. UP BJP president Mahendra Nath Pandey has been repeated from Chandauli. In Video:No Murli Manohar Joshi in BJP list of 43Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Work on Expressway bypass finally picks.description: MUMBAI: The work on building a bypass along the ghat section of the Mumbai-Pune Expressway has begun at a cost of Rs 6,695 crore, announced finance minister Sudhir Mungantiwar during his budget speech at the state legislative assembly on Tuesday. The project, which was introduced in 2014, has been delayed and it has resulted in cost escalation-almost double the initial estimate of nearly Rs 3,500 crore. The 20km bypass, which will have 11km of tunnels, 1.6km of bridges and an eight-lane road towards Khalapur (Panvel) and Kusgaon (near Sinhagad Institute), will reduce the Mumbai-Pune distance by half an hour as vehicles will be able to avoid the steep ghats and traffic jams. It is being carved out to separate the Expressway from the old highway. Traffic from the Expressway as well as the old highway take the same stretch through the ghats resulting in jams, delays, fuel consumption and pollution, said an official. The bypass will be part of the Expressway and the existing ghat section will remain purely for three and two-wheelers plying on the old highway.  MSRDC officials said work on the tunnel approach way towards Sinhagad Institute had already begun. While Navayuga Engineering Company is working on the tunnels, the viaduct or cable-stay bridges are being constructed by Afcons Infrastructure Limited. Geodata-LB consortium are the project consultants. The MSRDC is the nodal agency for the project. Also, around 30,000km of new roads are being built at a cost of Rs 18,000 crore under the Chief Minister Village Road Connectivity programme. Other projects underway are the Rs 55,000 crore Mumbai-Nagpur super-communication highway and around Rs 7,600 crore sewage, road and water supply projects undertaken by the PWD, Mungantiwar said. Now, complain to BMC on its Twitter hand.description: MUMBAI: Be it a leak in a water pipeline or a tree branch dangling dangerously, bad roads or garbage strewn on the streets, the BMC has a Twitter handle, @DisasterMgmtBMC, where you can report your concern. The handle is not new but in its new avatar it has been attending to citizen complaints for the past few days. In a meeting held on Monday, municipal commissioner Praveen Pardeshi directed ward-level officials to launch their own Twitter handles as well to address local issues. The BMC has roped in an external agency to assist it with the handle. The same agency handles the Mumbai Police handle. An official present at the meeting said that the municipal commissioner especially asked for complaints pertaining to waterlogging, water cuts, tree and branch crashes, and potholes to be addressed within four to six hours by the respective wards. Mumbai coastal road case: Chief justice.description: MUMBAI: Chief justice Pradeep Nandrajog of Bombay high court on Tuesday drew up a dystopian future for the human race if it stopped caring for the environment. A division bench of the chief justice and justice Nitin Jamdar was hearing public interest litigations challenging the alleged lack of approvals, including environmental clearances for the south coastal road that is part of the Mumbai coastal road project. At the close of the day’s hearings, the CJ predicted a bleak future “if we don’t care about the environment.” The chief justice passed a notepad to lawyers in the case with a caricature of a human being of the future affected with deformities as a result of pollution. The caricature resembled an alien being with an overgrown head due to high activity of brain cells, an elongated nose because of nasal chambers breathing in toxic and polluted air and small eyes which were a fallout of constant exposure to the computer screen. The being also had long arms due to computer use and short legs because of lack of movement and physical activity. The judge said the lack of concern for the environment will “affect future generations.” The bench is presently hearing arguments in the PILs against the work, including reclamation activities on the coast that started last year on the 10-km-long SCR. This is part of the 34-km-long coastal road that will finally connect Marine Lines to Kandivli. One of the major issues raised by the petitioners is lack of environmental clearance from the union ministry of environment and forests for the SCR. The BMC and state have claimed environmental clearance is not required. The authorities have cited the Coastal Regulation Zone (CRZ) approvals to support their case. Senior advocate Janak Dwarakadas, counsel for the petitioners, said the environmental clearance had additional requirements and conditions that were not there for CRZ approvals. Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Binoy Kodiyeri is my child\u2019s father.description: MUMBAI: A 33-year-old woman here, who has filed rape and cheating charges against CPM Kerala state secretary Kodiyeri Balakrishnan’s son, on Tuesday said that she had incontrovertible proof to show that Binoy Kodiyeri was the father of her child and that she herself was willing to undertake a DNA test to prove it. The woman had got an FIR registered against Binoy Kodiyeri at the Oshiwara police station here on June 13. The birth certificate and passport of the woman’s eight-year-old son show Binoy Vinodini Balakrishnan alias Binoy Balakrishnan Kodiyeri as his father. The woman has already submitted several documents to the Oshiwara police as evidence of her close relationship with the CPM leader’s son. The documents include her bank statements between 2010 and 2015, which showed Binoy Kodiyeri had electronically transferred Rs 80,000 to Rs 1 lakh every month to her as maintenance. Sources close to the woman said that her recent letter to Binoy, which the latter claimed was an attempt to blackmail, had merely sought more money from him for the boy’s upbringing. “The woman’s letter for Rs 5 crore was sent in consultation with her lawyer and it clearly says the money is to take care of their child,” a police officer confirmed. Sources told TOI that Oshiwara police were expecting Binoy Kodiyeri to cooperate with the investigation. “There are photos of the woman with Binoy Kodiyeri and their child, and even family photographs to prove that there was no problem between the two till 2015. Problem started after 2015 when Binoy Kodiyeri refused to give money to the woman and even stopped visiting her house,” a police officer told TOI. Mumbai police spokesperson Manjunath Singe said the Oshiwara police were collecting evidence before taking action and that he was unaware if any lookout notice was being issued for Binoy Kodiyeri. Petition against MIAL dismissed.description: MUMBAI: Bombay HC dismissed a petition by Stri Shakti Kendra, which runs a women taxi driver service, complaining against MIAL for sending them poor passenger flow at the international and domestic airport terminals and held that it could be a matter for policy to be framed by authorities. Road rage fear looms large for Mumbai tr.description: MUMBAI: Traffic police constable Rupesh Sawant's biggest fear of late is the possibility of being roughed up by a motorist stuck in a jam on Link Road. And his concern is very real. Ever since the closure of the Oshiwara nullah bridge on S V Road, there's been a huge influx of vehicles on Link Road, with snarls stretching up to Malad. "Motorists are angry and we don't blame them. Some of them are stuck in traffic twice a day-while going to work as well as when returning home. It ruins their entire day and they take out their ire on us," says Sawant. The traffic policeman is the first point of contact that motorists have with the authority. "Motorists have been expressing their irritation to us on the streets. Social media posts also blame us for bridge closures...but the decision has been the BMC's, we are only the implementing agency," says a traffic police sub-inspector. "We also get a lot of stick for bad traffic management. Beyond a point, where do we divert vehicles? Alternative routes are limited and have their own set of problems. For instance, Metro construction has gobbled up most of Link Road, leaving little space for the influx of vehicles." There are only 3,500 traffic cops in Mumbai, where vehicular population is over 36.4 lakh, as on March 2019. Currently, most of the personnel at traffic chowkies are on the roads managing vehicles due to bridge closures. "We have been trying our best to clear congestion from arterial roads during peak hours. Things will get tougher in monsoon with many roads going under. Snarls will get worse and motorists angrier," says a constable. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Om Birla.description: NEW DELHI: The BJP's surprise pick — Om Birla — is all set to become the next Lok Sabha Speaker after his candidature on Tuesday was backed by all NDA allies as also by the YSR Congress Party, the Biju Janata Dal and key opposition parties, including the Congress. A notice was given to the Lok Sabha Secretariat by the BJP, proposing the name of Birla, a two-time MP from Kota-Bundi seat in Rajasthan, for the Speaker's post and bringing a motion for his election, which will be held on Wednesday. As per sources, Prime Minister Narendra Modi proposed 57-year-old Birla's name for the post. The Rajasthan leader is considered to be close to both Modi and BJP president Amit Shah. 10 parties extend support to Om Birla's candidature for Lok Sabha speaker: Prahlad JoshiBirla's surprise nomination is seen by many in the BJP as a message from the top leadership that the party will promote leaders who keep a low-profile and work at the ground-level. BJD, YSRCP, JDU, Shiv Sena, Akali Dal, National People's Party, Mizo National Front, Lok Janshakti Party, AIADMK and Apna Dal have given the notice to support Birla's candidature for the Speaker's post, parliamentary affairs minister Pralhad Joshi told reporters. Later, Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said the party and the UPA allies have also decided to support the candidature of Birla as the Speaker. Chowdhury also said the Congress has already moved a motion supporting the ruling party candidate. The decision to support Birla's nomination was taken at a meeting of the UPA allies, where the leaders also discussed the opposition strategy during Parliament session. Birla won his first Lok Sabha election in 2014 and was re-elected from Rajasthan's Kota-Bundi seat. He defeated Congress's Ramnaraian Meena with a margin of over 2.5 lakh votes in the recently concluded general election. He has also been elected to Rajasthan assembly for three consecutive terms in 2003, 2008 and 2013. Birla will succeed eight-term MP Sumitra Mahajan as the Speaker, a post traditionally held by senior MPs. However, this will not be for the first time a relative newcomer will hold the position. In 1996, TDP leader G M C Balayogi was also a two-time MP when he was elected as the LS Speaker and after his death in a helicopter crash in 2002, Shiv Sena leader and the first-time MP Manohar Joshi was appointed to the position. Mumbai: Medical student jumps off buildi.description: MUMBAI: A 21-year-old youth studying in GS Medical College committed suicide by jumping from the terrace of his building at Dadar early Monday. While the reason behind the extreme step is still not clear, police said he had told his parents he was finding it difficult to cope up with two papers of Physiotherapy. Police have not found any suicide note. According to the police, the deceased, Onkar Mahesh Thakur, was the son of senior BMC officer, Mahesh Thakur. He was in the fourth year of Physiotherapy. Onkar is survived by his parents and an older sister studying in the US. Around 3.30 am on Monday, the security guard of Kohinoor Towers on Bal Govindas Road heard a loud thud. When he went to check, he found Onkar lying in a pool of blood. He alerted building residents who called the police and rushed him to KEM Hospital where he was declared dead before admission. Shivaji Park police have registered an accidental death report (ADR). Probe is on to find out how Onkar got access to the terrace keys. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" Mumbai: Now, resident doctors on strike.description: By: Rudraveer Reddy MUMBAI: Around 60 resident doctors from the RN Cooper Municipal General Hospital in Juhu proceeded on a strike on Tuesday, protesting against the unavailabilty of potable water for over a month. Medical services were hit as patients had to wait longer before they could see a doctor. Ram Pawar said that his nephew, Rupesh, who had been suffering fits and was unable to speak for a few days, waited for quite some time before a doctor attended to him. "We have come from Versova for an MRI. We can't afford to go to a big hospital. Now we're waiting for someone to look at him," Pawar said. Shabana Shaikh said her mother, Noor Jehan, had high blood pressure along with shortness of breath and coughing. "We've been here for two-three hours but she hasn't been admitted yet," she said. The doctors cited poor water quality in their living quarters as the primary reason for the strike."We've been having water that smells like sewage. There are residents who work in the operating theatre without taking a bath or washing their hands and are in danger of contracting diseases such as gastroenteritis," a rsident doctor said. Another resident doctor said there is no water from midnight till 8.30 am. "The problem has been there since more than 30 days, yet the administration's attitude is callous," the resident said. One junior doctor said the contaminated water was also used in the mess and canteen, where it could be consumed by patients and other doctors. A hospital official said all emergency, casualty and ICU patients were receiving care from the on-call doctors. The resident doctors said they had informed the dean and medical superintendent of their intention to strike in advance. "Arrangements have been made to provide mineral water cans," an official said. The students said the move was not enough and that every room had been allocated only two cans despite housing three doctors. "It's sad that the management doesn't care to resolve even basic problems till doctors go on a strike," a resident said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rera: Public body that sells land to bui.description: MUMBAI: In a landmark decision, state housing regulatory authority MahaRera has ruled that a public authority which sells land to developers cannot be made a promoter along with the builder in the housing project. Navi Mumbai builders who are members of CREDAI-MCHI (Raigad) had filed a complaint with MahaRera, seeking that the City and Industrial Development Corporation (Cidco) be made a co-promoter of their projects. They contended that Cidco delays its obligations after selling the plots and, as a result, their projects get held up and they are held liable for the delay. They said Cidco must be made a promoter under Rera because it is a public authority and MCHI members are allottees of plots owned by Cidco. MahaRera chairperson Gautam Chatterjee ruled that the sale transactions effected by Cidco are sale of immovable property where permissions for development is yet to be given by the competent authority. "Such transaction does not fall under the definition of a real estate project," he said. The order said Cidco can be made a promoter along with the builder in cases where Cidco is mandated to develop "off-site infrastructure" around the plot. In its complaint, MCHI said that Cidco does not register tenders inviting bids with Rera even though it was mandated to do so. "Cidco has not followed the provisions of Rera in its agreements and dealings with the highest bidder and is contravening the provisions of Rera," it said . The complainant said that Cidco is required to register the scheme as a project with Rera prior to advertising, marketing and inviting bids for the plots. Besides, Cidco is liable for various obligations to be performed pre- and post-tender like removal of encroachments and encumbrances, final demarcation of plot, providing water and drainage connections. The builders, who plan to file an appeal against Chatterjee's order, said Cidco frequently delays carrying out these tasks. As a result, they face flak from flat buyers, who drag them before the housing authority for project delays. "Cidco falls under the ambit of 'promoter' under Rera and its activities of inviting bids for plots and allotment of the same for lease of 60 years fall under the provisions of Rera," said the builders. Counsel for Cidco said the corporation sold plots after a public tender to prospective developers to develop and construct flats to be sold to third parties. "There we are not liable to register the sale of such plots with MahaRera," he said. In his order, Chatterjee said if the developer's plot acquired from Cidco is dependent on certain off-site infrastructure that has to be provided by Cidco, then "while registering their projects with MahaRera, the builders can include Cidco as a promoter (land-owner)". BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. Mumbai civic body says its new projects.description: MUMBAI: Dadar, Sion, Mahim and King’s Circle harbour several chronic waterlogging spots, and the most notorious of them all is Hindmata, known to go under water on any heavy rain day. This year, the municipal corporation says it is better prepared and will clear water from Hindmata faster. Though the BMC does not guarantee a totally flood-free area, it says the drain augmentation work it carried out in Hindmata will ensure rainwater does not remain accumulated for long periods. A visit to several waterlogging spots identified by the traffic police in Dadar, Sion, King’s Circle and Mahim found that while many works had been completed, concerns among locals remained. Works to reconstruct 2,500 metres of storm water drain (SWD) lines were taken up by the BMC around Hindmata — at Madkebuwa Chowk at Parel and Lalbaug police chowki. In the stretch from Lalbaug police chowky to Shravan Yashwante Chowk, while earlier there was an SWD line of 3000 mm by 2700 mm, there is an extra SWD proposed of 1,800 mm diameter, said officials. This work, though not fully complete, is expected to provide some relief. “This is a low-lying area and one cannot give a guarantee that water will not accumulate on a heavy rain day. But with augmentation works done, we hope that unlike earlier years, when rainwater would remain for an entire day, the accumulation may last only a few hours,” local corporator Urmila Panchal from the Shiv Sena said. A resident of Bhoiwada, Panchal said pumps for de-watering had also been placed. Then there are the other waterlogging spots like Dadar TT and Five Gardens. Dadar Parsi Colony resident Zarine Engineer said: “Dadar TT would previously witness a lot of waterlogging but that has reduced now considerably. With waterlogging spots identified in the area, my only concern is that that manhole lids are placed in all areas.” In King’s Circle, Gandhi Market remain a flooding spot. “It’s a very complex issue as we are not able to find space for laying an SWD line,” an official said. Local corporator Rajeshree Shirwadkar said she had six flooding spots in her area. “The problem with Gandhi market is that there is a water line running below, owing to which the SWD system cannot be widened,” she said. “The solution may be the pending Mahul pumping station.” In Mahim, spots like Mahim junction, Lady Jamshedji Road and Mahim Causeway see localised flooding. Officials said they placed pumps there. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. Ajit Pawar says proposals up on Twitter.description: Why were the budgetary proposals posted on finance minister Sudhir Mungantiwar’s Twitter handle before they were read out? Former deputy chief minister and senior NCP leader Ajit Pawar asked this question to chief minister Devendra Fadnavis and Mungantiwar and called it “a clear case of breach of privilege. The information was available on the FM’s Twitter handle before the budget proposal was presented to the legislature. Both the CM and the FM must tender an unconditional apology to the legislature.” Fadnavis defended the FM saying the information were posted only after it was disclosed in the legislature. “The FM began reading his budget speech at 2pm while it was available on his Twitter handle at 2.16pm. No rules were breached. In fact, the same procedure is followed when the Union budget is presented,” said Fadnavis. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

With Ashish Shelar in cabinet, Manoj Kot.description: MUMBAI: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) member of Parliament Manoj Kotak is the frontrunner for the post of party’s city unit chief as the incumbent Ashish Shelar has been appointed as a cabinet minister in the Devendra Fadnavis government. BJP’s constitution has provisioned for one-man, one-post and it will have to look for a new BJP chief for Mumbai. BJP appointed J P Nadda as working president, after party chief Amit Shah took over as Union minister for home. “Kotak, who is close to Fadnavis, is the frontrunner for the job,” said a BJP functionary said on the condition of anonymity. “Fadnavis would like to see his man appointed as the city BJP chief.” Both, former MP Kirit Somaiya and the dropped cabinet minister Prakash Mehta, had been the Gujarati faces of the party for decades. However, the leadership has now decided to look beyond these two as they have fallen foul of the party leadership. “Kotak’s appointment will send out the message that the party has the interest of the community in mind. Hence, the party has also appointed BJP MLA from Charkop, Yogesh Sagar, as minister of state in the Fadnavis cabinet,” said a party functionary. Also, the chief minister is wanting to have his men to be a bridge between the Gujarati-Kutchi community and him, instead of depending on Mehta and Somaiya. Kotak, though a Gujarati, is very fluent in Marathi. “His appointment will not be looked upon as BJP favouring Gujarati over a Marathi. He has a good connect at the grassroots level as he was a corporator on three occasions,” said a source. Another BJP functionary said, “He is well aware of playing to the gallery as he took the oath as an MP in the Lok Sabha on Monday in Marathi. Whereas, Poonam Mahajan and Gopal Shetty took the oath in Hindi.” While Shiv Sena was averse to Kirit Somaiya, it had no qualms in extending support to Kotak. Maharashtra will fill vacant 19,000 cons.description: To strengthen the police force, the state has granted permission to fill 18,992 vacant constable posts. Also, 4,649 new constable posts will be created this year, states the budget. Funds will be made available to procure modern weapons and technologies for the police to fight naxals. Asaduddin Owaisi.description: NEW DELHI: Asaduddin Owaisi, president of All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM), was greeted with slogans of 'Jai Shri Ram', 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' and 'Vande Mataram' on Tuesday as he went on to take oath as a member of the 17th Lok Sabha here. Owaisi, a Member of Parliament (MP) from Hyderabad constituency, in response, said, "Jai Bheem, Jai Meem, Takbeer Allahu Akbar, Jai Hind" while concluding his oath. Later, responding to opposition's gesture, Owaisi told ANI, "I think, it's good that they remember such things after seeing me. I hope they remember our constitution and the deaths of children in Muzaffarpur as well. I will keep an eye on them." Besides, Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) lone MP from Punjab's Sangrur, Bhagwant Mann, raised 'Inquilab Zindabad' slogans at the end of his oath-taking ceremony earlier today. #WATCH: Slogans of Bharat Mata ki Jai and Vande Mataram raised in the Lok Sabha as AIMIM MP from Hyderabad Asaduddi… https://t.co/6QTgnFYG6x— ANI (@ANI) 1560854690000This comes after BJP MP from Bhopal Pragya Singh Thakur ended her oath taking ceremony with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogan on Monday. Subsequently, every BJP member continued to raise slogans. Moreover, chants of 'Jai Shri Ram' marked the oath-taking by minister Babual Supriyo, elected from Asansol in West Bengal, where the chanting of the slogan became a political issue during the recent elections. The furore over 'Jai Shri Ram' slogan started in the state after West Bengal chief minister Banerjee lost her cool when a group of men chanted 'Jai Shri Ram' as her convoy was passing through Bhatpara area in North 24 Parganas district earlier this month. Bombay HC dismisses plea by women taxi d.description: MUMBAI: Priyadarshini Taxi services through its founder Susiieben Shah and six women taxi drivers, approached the Bombay high court on Tuesday to seek two independent prepaid taxi service slots to its women drivers at the Mumbai International Airport, Terminal 2. Stri Shakti Kendra and its president Shah said that the issue is of “non-implementation of a Resolution passed by the Regional Transport Authority, Greater Mumbai Area on 26th May 2010 for allotting two independent slots in the prepaid category in Cool Cabs to Taxi Services driven by women (Priyadarshini Taxi Services).’’ A bench of Justices S C Dharmadhikari and BP Colabawala posted the matter for hearing to Thurdsday. The petitions wants the Mumbai International Airport Ltd to “renew or issue a fresh of lntent’’ for at leats thre years form March 31, 2019 to ply women driven taxi services from a counter allotted at T2 as well as from the domestic terminal of the Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport. They want that they be allowed to operate free of any obstructions, they face. In February 2012 the HC had directed the Airport Authority of India to permit pre-paid taxi services run by women taxi drivers from existing slots. MIAL was also directed to submit a report on the system. The petition says that there has been a delay “for one reason or the other’’ in allotting slots to women taxi drivers. MIAL had raised security and law and order concerns that might be raised by taxi unions over inclusion of women taxi drivers in pre-paid slots, as one of the reasons. Water stock dips to 6.1%, Vaitarna hits.description: MUMBAI: The combined water stock in the seven lakes that serve the city dipped to 6.1% of the total capacity as the wait for rains continued on Tuesday. Municipal officials said there was no need to panic as the lakes held enough, along with reserve stocks, to last all of next month. The BMC supplies the city 3,420 million litres of water every day, while the stock in the lakes stands at 88,743 million litres, the lowest in three years for this time of the year. Useful water stock in Upper Vaitarna stands at zero, while in Bhatsa, which is one of the bigger lakes supplying water to the city, it is at 0.9%. The Bhatsa system supplies water to the eastern suburbs and some parts of the island city like Matunga, Sion, Dongri and Byculla. Last year on the same day the water quantum stood at 14.8%, or 215 thousand million litres. On June 18, 2017, the stock was 18.6%, or 270 thousand million litres. The seven supplier lakes are Bhatsa, Tulsi, Vihar, Middle Vaitarna, Modak Sagar, Tansa and Upper Vairtarna. The BMC had in April sought the permission of the state government to draw water from the reserve stock if required, which was granted. There was rain in the city and its adjoining areas owing to the presence of cyclone Vayu in the Arabian Sea last week but the precipitaion in the catchment areas of the lakes was not significant. The total rainfall received was 55 mm in Upper Vaitarna, 70 mm in Modak Sagar, 49 mm in Tansa and 52 mm in Bhatsa. Bandra corporator Asif Zakeria said that in case it did not rain soon there were concerns that the BMC would increase the water cuts. “There have already been complaints about irregular water supply in some parts of Bandra like Kadeshwari and Pimpleshwar Wadi and also occasional complaints from areas like Mount Mary,” he said. A BMC official said they were monitoring the situation. “The stocks in Upper Vaitarna are zero, but then the entire Vaitarna system is made up of Upper Vaitarna, Middle Vaitarna, Modak Sagar and Tansa lakes, which does have live water storage,” the official said. Consumer injured in joyride, insurance c.description: Hiren Joshi had taken a Happy Family Floater Policy of Rs 6 lakh from Oriental Insurance which covered him, his wife and his dependant parents. The policy included personal accident coverage. Hiren got married and went on a honeymoon to Manali on a trip organized by Heena Tours and Travels. One of the attractions was paragliding. The paragliding activities were operated by trained persons. Hiren’s parachute, however, developed a technical snag, and the pilot could not control it, leading to a crash on a rocky hill. Hiren sustained grievous injuries in the accident which occurred on December 10, 2014. He was hospitalized till January 6, 2015 after which he returned to Mumbai for further hospitalization and treatment which continued till April 4, 2015. As the accident had occurred during subsistence of the policy-- valid from November 20, 2014 to November 19, 2015-- he filed a claim under the policy. The insurer rejected the claim on the ground that paragliding was a risky activity, and that the policy did not cover accidents occurring during aviation or ballooning except as a bonafide passenger. Since Hiren was paragliding, the insurer termed it a hazardous activity which was excluded under the policy. Hiren approached the insurance ombudsman who upheld the insurer’s stand, so he filed a consumer complaint. Advocate Ami Mandani who represented Hiren, argued the exclusion clause was not applicable since Hiren was not operating the parachute while paragliding, but was merely enjoying a joy ride which was being operated by a trained pilot. Even a tour operator had endorsed this fact, but the insurer argued the tour operator was not entitled to opine. It defended the repudiation under clause 4.19 of the policy.  The forum observed the policy was in existence since several years during which period no claim had been made. It concurred with advocate Ami Mandani that the exclusion clause would not apply to joy rides under trained pilots. The forum also noted that clause 4.19 of the policy had no bearing on the dispute. Accordingly, by its order of June 1, 2019 delivered by M P Kashar for the bench headed by Sneha Mhatre and D S Paradkar, the forum concluded the claim had been wrongly repudiated which constituted a deficiency in service. It noted even though the expenses for treatment had exceeded the coverage limit, Hiren had restricted his claim to the benefits available under the policy. The forum ordered Oriental Insurance to pay Rs 6 lakh for medical expenses and Rs 1,28,125 as personal accident benefit. Both these amounts would carry 3% interest from the date of the complaint being filed. In addition, Rs7,000 was awarded as compensation for mental agony and Rs 3,000 as litigation costs. The insurer has been given two months to comply with the order. (The author is a consumer activist and has won the Govt. of India’s National Youth Award for Consumer Protection. His email is jehangir.gai.columnist@outlook.in)Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Maharashtra tops US Green Building Counc.description: MUMBAI: According to a recent assessment done by the US Green Building Council (USGBC), Maharashtra tops among Indian states for hosting the most environment-friendly buildings that save electricity and other green resources. The state stood first in a USGBC list of India's top 10 states for LEED (Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design), which is the world's most widely used green building rating system. This is the second year that the list has been released in India. Its ranking system is based on considering each state's creation of cumulative gross square feet of LEED-certified space as of December 31, 2018. Koradi power project granted in principl.description: MUMBAI: An “in principle approval” has been given for a thermal power generation project of 1,320MW capacity at Koradi in Nagpur, it was announced during the state budget on Tuesday.  An expenditure of Rs 8,407 crore is expected for this project. “A decision has also been taken to expand the capacity of old sub stations and set up new sub stations with a view to modernize and expand electricity distribution system,” said finance minister Sudhir Mungantiwar. Under this scheme, the capacity of 493 substations has been hiked. Mungantiwar said, “Considering farmers’ demand, 5,26,884 agricultural pumps have been energized in the past four years. For 2018-19, the aim is power 75,000 agricultural pumps at a cost of Rs 1,875 crore.” He said in four years, concessions worth crores were provided to farm customers, powerlooms and industrial consumers. He said the state has begun commissioning a high voltage distribution system to reduce distribution losses. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal.
